bug.author: Sangarshanan
bug.summary: Map views don't change when changing latlongs with selectbox
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I have dataframe that contains the latlongs of different cities which can be filtered using selectbox but when I change the city even though the latlongs get affected the default view does not change. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>import streamlit as st import pandas as pd
st.title('View latlongs') DATA_URL = ('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/d3/d3-plugins/master/graph/data/cities.csv') df = pd.read_csv(DATA_URL)
option = st.selectbox('Which place?',('Excelsior', 'Crocker Amazon', 'Nob Hill', 'Marina')) st.write('You selected:', option) df = df[(df['name']== option)]
st.map(df)
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The map would need to auto center when the view is altered <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The map view does not change <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Nope <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit, version 0.48.1 Python 3.6.8 Conda OS version: Python 3.6.8 Browser version: Version 76.0.3809.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)

comments.comment: It appears to be a problem with st.map -- if I do st.write(df) before it, the dataframe shows that it does update correctly. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98836/74493171-2ade0900-4e86-11ea-89dc-14ad45e65c67.png></denchmark-link>

The issue is fixed on v0.61.0 However there is an <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/1484>issue with zooming </denchmark-link> so we have to change to in the provided sample code for it to work.
